22855266.review:
In between sessions of gorging yourself on the latest hundred hour, open-world extravaganza, or main-lining some twitchy, fast paced multiplayer title for weeks at a time, it's nice to take a break every once in a while to enjoy something a little slower or more small scale to cleanse the palette and keep things interesting. Enter Zenge, just what the doctor ordered for such a thing.

Zenge is a puzzle game where you slide various shapes along tracks and assemble them to form a picture. Initially they must simply be slid along and put into place in the right order so they can freely move along the tracks without colliding into one another. But as stages progress (70 in total), new features are added, like junctions along the tracks where pieces can be flipped, rotated, teleported or even embiggened or ensmallened to add some spice to the challenge. It's all fiendishly clever and really gets the grey matter firing in a very satisfying way that rarely ever frustrates.

The game is incredibly beautiful, too. From the simple yet striking art design, to the gentle, lulling music, everything seems made with the intention of relaxing the player while they try to unravel the conundrums. There is a story told through still images, each one revealed as reward when you assemble the pieces that make each puzzle, but I'll be honest with you, I don't know what the hell it was about. Something about some Ludo pieces finding artefacts related to the game then playing with each other or something, but it pretty much lost me by the end. Though, that said, even if I didn't get it, I still loved the artwork all the same and am happy enough with that.

The difficulty of the puzzles felt maybe a little inconsistent on occasion? I had a few moments where progress slowed a little toward the back half, but then I was breezing through the later stages.  But that may simply be human nature and not everyone will find the same parts as easy or hard as others may. I imagine most will finish the game in around 90 minutes or so, and there isn't any real replay value, but at such a low cost I really can't see many complaining by the time they finish. I know I enjoyed every minute of it.

So, for hardcore puzzle lovers and casual enthusiasts alike, this gets a resounding thumb being jammed onto a fist, rotated into an upright position, then slid upwards from me. Two of them, in fact.

22731295.review:
Zenge, desenvolvido pela Hamster on Coke Games, é um jogo de puzzle que conta a história de Eon, um homem solitário preso entre universos e o tempo.

Os puzzles são espécies de quebra-cabeças e consistem em mover e rotacionar peças pelo caminho certo com o objetivo de encaixá-las e formar uma figura que te contará mais sobre a história de Eon.

O jogo não possui pontos, o seu prêmio é destravar partes da história.

Os desafios em si não são tão difíceis, eles ficam mais exigentes para o final mas não são impossíveis. O jogo em si também é bastante curto.

Zenge é um jogo relaxante, com linda trilha sonora, lindas ilustrações sobre a história de Eon, com puzzles simples porém inteligentes e interessantes. Ótimo para passar o tempo.

A história contada por meio das imagens também é linda. Vale a pena prestar atenção. As ilustrações, em estilo low-poly, também são maravilhosas.

[h1][b]Prós:[/b][/h1]

- Bonita história, contada através de lindas ilustrações em low-poly
- Linda e relaxante trilha sonora
- Puzzles não muito difíceis, porém interessantes, e que destravam partes da história ao invés de pontos

[h1][b]Contras:[/b][/h1]

- Talvez ser um pouco curto seja um problema, mas o jogo é barato e entrega bastante conteúdo para o que propõe

[h1][b]Nota final:[/b][/h1]

9/10

22623547.review:
The goal of Zenge is to guide the piece into their correct places along a path. In order to do this, you'll have to move other pieces out of the way, makes the piece smaller, rotate the pieces, or teleport them. After you finish a level, you are given a beautifully designed illustration (for lack of a better word) that makes up the plot of the game, which, according to the developer's website, "[tells] the story of Eon - a lonely journeyman who's stuck between the worlds and time."

It took me 7.5 hours to beat the game, which is think is a good length for this game, The game itself is free of any point system, which does genuinely fit in with the developer's intent of the game being a relaxing experience. While I wouldn't go out and purchase the soundtrack, it is very nice to listen to, 

If I do have to find some criticisms with the game, I'd say that to turn the sound on or off, you have to go to the level select and it would be nice if the options were also available in the levels. Another problem I have is this game being rated EC, as this indicates that the game is intented for a very young audience. I also feel that this game may not have any kind of replay value if you already know how to solve all the levels.

For an asking price of just $0.99, this is definitely worth checking out. However, if you'd like to check it out for free, a demo of the game is available on Kongregate, but there aren't as many levels available.

22536483.review:
Le principe de [i][b]Zenge[/b][/i] est simple : pour finir un niveau, vous devez faire glisser des fragments de formes variées, afin de les disposer d'une façon déterminée. Des fragments qui correspondent aux morceaux d'une image, laquelle permet d'illustrer l'histoire de ce petit bonhomme nommé Eon.

Pour ce faire, ces pièces peuvent emprunter différents chemins, déjà tracés, mais ne s'arrêteront que si elles rencontrent un noeud, marqué par un point. Contrainte supplémentaire : qu'il advienne que l'une d'elles percute un obstacle (autrement dit, une autre pièce) et c'est un retour à la case départ. Ou plutôt au noeud d'où elle provient. Il faudra donc veiller à libérer le passage.

Différentes mécaniques sont introduites tout au long du jeu : un symbole permet la rotation de ces pièces, un autre d'en obtenir la symétrie - désolé, déformation professionnelle... - selon un axe vertical ou horizontal et un troisième de les téléporter aux endroits marqués du même symbole (non, je n'ai pas dit translation... ah si). Enfin, des chemins de diverses couleurs ne seront débloqués que si une pièce précise se trouve à un endroit précis.

En bref, un puzzle-game sympathique, sans grande prétention (ce que ne dément pas son prix, d'ailleurs) qui vous occupera le temps d'une heure ou deux. Ne vous attendez pas à un challenge relevé, l'affaire est vite pliée. Par contre, la bande son est excellente et colle parfaitement à l'étrange périple de ce petit être tout aussi étrange.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Très bon, une valeur sûre ![/h1]

22450482.review:
Okay, I just beat this and honestly, it was probably the best 71 pence I've spent in a long while.

The thing that drew me to the game was the art style, I won't lie, I bought this game based on the screenshots a lone - I didn't read the description, or the reviews. I went in expecting a puzzle game similar to Hook, and to be honest that's not far off of what I got - an exceedingly polished, aesthetically pleasing, no-pressure puzzle game.

It took me 70 minutes to beat - which when combined with the price paid, well exceeds the standard "£1 to 1 hour" rule that so many people seem to hold in such high regard - which personally I don't, if I enjoyed the experience then it was probably worth the price. Of course, it's a puzzle game, so YMMV - I could imagine people beating this in a solid half hour, or even taking several hours to never beat it.

While it's not an excessively or inherently difficult puzzle game, it does require some decent spacial analysis - although some people will be pleased to hear that it seems to be impossible to 'trap' yourself and be forced to restart a board. I didn't manage to do that in any of the levels, although I did restart a few purely because I need to work something out from the beginning - that's just how my mind works when solving problems.

If you're looking for a chill experience, with some wonderful art and music, with a little bit of story thrown in - I'd say go ahead and drop the sub-£1 fare for entry here and just have an hour of no worries or distractions, just solid puzzle solving fun.

22450351.review:
I bought the game on a whim, since it was so cheap.
I plowed through it in a couple of sessions,
and in the end I was left with an overwhelming feeling of...

"Meh. It was alright, I guess."

There's [b]nothing technicly wrong[/b] with this game.
The art is beautiful.
The music is  soothing.
The puzzle mechanics are nice, varied and used in different ways.

But in the end, I spent less time thinking about the puzzles than I did executing the needed actions. I was hardly ever actually stumped. Rarely did I notice having made actual mistakes. Most of the time I was just plowing forward with either obvious moves or educated guesses.

But do note, the above may be a [i]positive[/i] for you. The mechanics are introduced well and the difficulty ramp is smoot. Also, the puzzles seem to be designed in a way that you can easily work your way to the solution step by step. I've also played a lot of puzzle games, so you may find these puzzles more challenging than I did.

But I was just left wanting just a bit more challenge.

为什么是满分，因为他真的把简单的拼图游戏挖出了一个非常深的深度，你从不会玩腻，因为当你稍微觉得有些乏味的时候，不，在你觉得乏味之前，他就会把新的玩法在下一关抛出来，从一开始的单纯滑动到后面的粘合，到后面的反转，诸如此类，总之他很轻松的就花光了我一个下午的时间，直到吃晚饭的点到了才想起来去吃晚饭。
上手度 10/10
从易到难的渐进做的相当到位！相当到位！相当到位！重要的事情说三遍，真的，不知不觉中你就玩到了很后面，攻克了越来越难的关卡。
剧情线 10/10
我跟你讲这款解谜游戏是有剧情的哦！他无时无刻不在向你讲述故事，每一关结束出现的唯美的极简的图片，就是这个故事的一部分，讲道理我现在玩Zenge有很大的程度是为了看故事2333333333
画面+系统 8/10
极简主义的画面虽然简单但是不失唯美，唯美的画面之中却又包含了连续的引人入胜的故事。不过还是有提升的空间。另外，退出游戏的时候没有提示这一点是唯一让我不开心的一点了，也没告诉我什么时候保存了还有再次确认一遍我要不要退游戏。不过瑕不掩瑜。
音乐 8/10
贴合游戏模式，听着不会腻，而且很好听。有一种……行走在宇宙中的孤独感。

这是我做过的第一个游戏测评，如果有什么地方觉得不好的，请多多包涵。
实在是因为游戏实在太吸引我了，忍不住过来写了两句。
以上。
Yesen

Zenge is quite a fun little puzzle game!

I would give this game 4 out of 5 points. Why 4? Well I took one point off because of the story, that is a bit hard to follow and where you have to use a lot of your imagination. Other than that I really really loved this game and I do recommend it. Hell with this price a game like this feels like you have gotten it for free! I wouldn't have minded to buy it for 5 bucks! You get a better game than any EA games have been for around 10+ years and all that with just 99 cents!

* The puzzles were quite interesting, not too easy not too hard!
* Game is finishable.
* It's relaxing.
* Awesome relaxing music, though might get a bit repetitive, would've recommended a few more tracks.
* Interesting story with a more interesting way to tell it.
* Cheap!

As I also played and finished Art of Gravity I thought this game might be a bit worse, but was I wrong! It's different yes, but is it worse? I wouldn't say that. I enjoyed it a lot and I do recommend this for both kids and adults! Keep up to good job guys and keep em coming!

39567622.review:
Zenge is a short puzzle game in an alternative jigsaw way, the game can be fun for some, beatiful for others, and boring as well.

Zenge is a alternative jigsaw puzzle game, where you need to put the pieces in the correct area and form a image, still, the pieces you have, isn't the full image, it's just a part, and as you finish this little part, the rest of the image cames to complete by itself. The pieces are put in diferent areas and conected to the place where they belong to by a web, you need to use the web to make it tru. Also in some parts you'll use "powers" that can make the piece rotate, teleport and shrink/grow, all this will be needed to make the level.

The gameplay is about to hold the piece and drag to what part of the web you want it to go, it can be a little annoying to do it and sometimes don't get the piece at first.

As the game goes, the images that forms shows a story, there is no way to discover the true story behind it in a simple way, it's all about your brain trying to make the story as it thinks it's correct. The images has a nice art design, and still you can be confused about it, but it's really nice to see it.

The music is quite amazing, it fits in the universe of the game, and it will be your partner tru all the gameplay.

The menu is simple as possible, you can choose what level you want to play, IF you've unlocked already, mute sounds and mute music (To quit the game it's the old ESC) there is no credits and no gallery that can be a little sad.

The credits reshows all the images in order so you can remember all the journey that the character did, the missing of a gallery can be a little sad for some lovers of art, so you need to play the level again and screenshot the art. Or do it on the first gameplay, it's easier.

The price is quite good for what the game offers, a nice artwork, a gorgeous soundtrack, a diferent gameplay, a simple game, that can be beat within 1 hour or even less. Refunds are not allowed if you liked the game! :3

91/100 "Gorgeous"

谜题很简单，通过指定路线和图形旋转变换空间移动达到目标图形。无聊时可以打发时间。
买解谜包入的，个人觉得是五款游戏中第二好的一款，总体来说不错，更喜欢HOOK一些，不过这个打折的游戏价格也算很值了。
